description.narrative: Intermediate Results (IR) 2.1 Enabling Learning Environment Existence of an enabling environment (budgetary, knowledge, legislative, policy, and systems ) to enhance learning for all children, especially the most marginalized., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Field/Country Office Oversight, Management And Operations Support, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Sanitation, Technical Excellence In Procurement And Management Of Supplies, Unicef Capacity For Supply And Logistics, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 2 Keep Children LearningImproved education quality and learning outcomes using an equitable and inclusive approach with a focus on girls' education

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

sector.narrative: Administrative data, registers and non-MICS household surveys and censuses
Child marriage - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)
Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.

HQ Supply - technical excellence in supply chain, procurement of goods and services, and logistics, including creating healthy markets, supply financing solutions, and sustainable national supply chain systems
HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Management and Operations support at CO
Other activities for equitable access to quality education e.g. school feeding, school grants
Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of early learning / pre-primary education teacher training
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
Provision of parental education for school readiness (including in temporary learning spaces)
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
System strengthening - community participation and social accountability, e.g. school management committees
System strengthening - curricula and learning materials design (excluding early-learning / pre-primary)
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary policy, leadership, and budget
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary standards and governance
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
System strengthening - mother tongue / multilingual education
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education
United Nations Girls' Education Initiative (UNGEI) Secretariat

description.narrative: Development Partner affairs policy planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Uganda United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans
UN Sustainable Development Group Database of Common Country Analyses
UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework
UNICEF Uganda Humanitarian Action for Children Appeal (HAC)
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Uganda 2021 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 2.1 Enabling Learning Environment Existence of an enabling environment (budgetary, knowledge, legislative, policy, andsystems ) to enhance learning for all children, especially the most marginalized.
2.1.2: Number of planned policies or legislative instruments to enhance equity developed or revised to ensure a legal and budgetary framework that keeps children learning
2.1.4 Number of schools implementing a mobile monitoring system
2.1.1: Number of planned studies and/or evaluations
2.1.5. Number of districts including DRR in their work plans

target.value: 2015:28 districts with DRR included in their district plans

actual.value: 2015:Conflict & disaster risk management guidelines have been developed with MoES and will support the mainstreaming of DRR in education work plans in 30 focus districts.

title.narrative: Increased MoES budget allocation for ECD

actual.value: 2015:The MoES budget for ECD was supported by GPE for ECD monitoring and care givers training.
2015:The approved Uganda GPE allocation includes a budget of $7 million for ECD, based on the submitted work plan.
